summary: This document is an AT&T international call detail record (CDR) report, created on August 10, 2019, in response to a legal query. It lists numerous phone call records spanning from January 2003 to November 2007, indicating a broad investigation into communications during that period. The data includes connection times, originating and dialed numbers, and call durations, but no specific names are mentioned in the provided text.

events.title: AT&T Call Record Query Execution
events.description: AT&T runs a query for international call detail records from January 2003 to December 2007, in response to a legal matter (ID: 2787395).

keyFacts: AT&T produced a comprehensive international call detail record report covering a five-year period from 2003 to 2007 for a legal investigation (Matter ID: 2787395).
The report was created on August 10, 2019, indicating a recent data pull for an ongoing or historical investigation.
The document lists over 140 individual call records, showing a pattern of frequent international communications during the specified timeframe.
No personal names, locations, or specific content of calls are revealed in the provided text; it is purely metadata (dates, times, numbers).
The records are stored in UTC time but were queried using Eastern Time, and AT&T notes it may not have handled calls end-to-end.
